titles.title: This World Is Not My Home

verse.name: c1a
verse.lines:
O Lord, you know
I have no friend like you,
If heaven’s not my home
then Lord, what will I do;

verse.name: c1b
verse.lines:
The angels beck-on me
from heaven’s open door,
And I can’t feel at home
in this world anymore.

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
This world
is not my home,
I’m just a passing thru,
My treasures are laid up
somewhere beyond the blue;

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
The angels beckon me
from heaven’s open door,
And I can’t feel at home
in this world anymore.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
They’re all expecting me,
and that’s one thing I know,
My Savior pardoned me
and now I onward go;

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
I know He’ll take me thru
tho I am weak and poor.
And I can’t feel at home
in this world anymore.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
I have a loving mother
up in glory land,
I don’t expect to stop
until I shake her hand;

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
She’s waiting now for me
in heaven’s open door,
And I can’t feel at home
in this world anymore.

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
Just up in glory land
we’ll live eternally,
The saints on ev’ry hand
are shouting victory;

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
Their song
of sweetest praise
drift back
from heaven’s shore,
And I can’t feel at home
in this world anymore.
